reviews.review_msg: Professor Becalska was a caring prof and shows interest in teaching the course. However her lecture exam's say otherwise, the exam's are mainly theory questions where she looks for a specific word for you to use not covered in the lecture notes. She says the exams aren't cumulative but if you dont keep your knowledge from previous exams you'll fail

She's a really good lecturer, explains topics well and effectively, and ensures that the class is understanding it. When it comes to her exams though, it's completely different. A huge portion of the questions come directly from the lecture slides, which are very densly packed with information. Read the slides, that'd save you.

Her exams were entirely based on lecture slides, word for word. Exam keys looked for just key WORDS/POINTS for full marks. 
Lectures were focused on the "bigger" picture.

Honestly, she's a nice person and tries to make you understand the material rather than memorize it. Her exam material is a whole other ballgame. It's challenging and does not accurately reflect what was taught. She answers lots of students questions in class and has iclicker questions. Overall, difficult as expected and exams r kinda unreasonable.

Obviously class is heavy as it is a beginner course. She is very engaging and tries to get you to understand material. The midterms are a bit harder as they are more application based questions rather than memory. So you  really need to understand material well.
She is great and is very easy to understand. Her lectures are easy to follow and engaging. Also is very approachable and will take the time to explain concepts.

Dr. Becalska's other reviews scared me a little but this was easily my favorite lab experience so far because of her. She is so kind and dedicated to making sure you walk away with great lab skills and understanding of the material. Always asks for feedback, encourages questions and gives TONS of resources to help with procedures and theory.

Not sure where to start with this one. Probably the most disrespectful prof with no communication skills. Doesn't respond to emails, seriously eye rolled when asked questions which I found disrespectful so I stopped asking. The TA cared more about teaching while she was on her phone in lab. Grading is just super biased. Worst prof i ever had!!

The grading criteria is not clear at all, as even if you try to follow it fully, you still have a low chance of getting a good grade. In this lab majority of your marks are dependent upon big projects which are graded very subjectively. She is very sassy, and sometimes seems rude, but overall nice. Do not take this class if you care about gpa.

Disrespectful towards students. Very sassy and gives attitude when explaining things. Her guidelines are so off from her marking rubric its insane how she's getting away with this. Constantly on her phone and totally zoned out of the lab. Created a very uncomfortable environment, the whole class seemed scared to ask questions. Super judgmental.

Nice lady, somewhat clear instructions, however, very vicious grader on projects. Was given two assignments that I spent many hours on, confirming with her, whether the everything is correct or any feedback, corrected the feedback. However, the instructions she gave seems contradictory to the grading. would not recommend if you value GPA

Agata is the sweetest lab professor I have had, she truly cares for people and how they do. The key in the lab to do well is to ask questions, you cannot expect her and the TA to attend to your every need. Overall she is very responsive in her emails and very helpful in person you just have to put the work in!

This Lab Instructor is nothing but disrespectful to people. She gives a lot of attitude and is persistently on her phone or chatting with the TA. I would not recommend taking the lab with her. Very incompetent Instructor.
Agata is a great prof. She can be a tough grader sometimes.
